required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing the Association Between Multi-dimension Facial Characteristics and Coronary Artery Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Artificial Intelligence to Assess the Association Between Multi-dimension Facial Characteristics and Coronary Artery Diseases

lead_sponsor.agency: China National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases

clinical_study.source: China National Center for Cardiovascular Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: The purposes of this study are 1) to explore the association between multi-dimension facial characteristics and the increased risk of coronary artery diseases (CAD); 2) to evaluate the diagnostic efficacy of multi-dimension appearance factors for coronary artery diseases.

detailed_description.textblock:
Previous study demonstrated the feasibility of using deep learning to detect coronary artery disease based on facial photos. However, several limitations made the algorithm hard to be utilized in clinical practice, including low specificity and lack of external validation. Adding multi-dimension facial characteristics may further increase the algorithm effect.
Thus, the investigators designed a single-center, cross-sectional study to explore the association between multi-dimension facial characteristics and CAD and to evaluate the predictive efficacy of multi-dimension appearance factors for CAD. The investigators will recruit patients undergoing coronary angiography or coronary computer tomography angiography. Patients' baseline information and multi-dimension facial images will be collected. The investigators will train and validate a deep learning algorithm based on multi-dimension facial photos.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of enrollment (1 mouth)
primary_outcome.description: Area under receiver operating curve of algorithm assessed in test group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of enrollment (1 mouth)
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of algorithm assessed in test group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of enrollment (1 mouth)
secondary_outcome.description: Specificity of algorithm assessed in test group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of enrollment (1 mouth)
secondary_outcome.description: PPV of algorithm assessed in test group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of enrollment (1 mouth)
secondary_outcome.description: NPV of algorithm assessed in test group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of enrollment (1 mouth)
secondary_outcome.description: Diagnostic accuracy rate of algorithm assessed in test group

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing coronary angiography or coronary computer tomography angiography will be enrolled. Patients data will be used to training and validate the algorithm for CAD detection based on facial photos.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who undergo coronary angiography or coronary computer tomography angiography from both resident patients and outpatient.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Undergoing coronary angiography or coronary computer tomography angiography
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI)
- Prior coronary artery bypass graft (CABG)
- Screening coronary artery disease before treating other heart diseases
- Without blood biochemistry outcome
- With artificially facial alteration (i.e. cosmetic surgery, facial trauma or make-up)
- Other situations which make patients fail to be photographed
